snippet: The problem persists even in workplaces committed to gender equality, and those who stand in the way of fairness do so at their own peril.
abstract: Editorial points to importance of addressing wage gap between women and men, given that women are primary or co-breadwinner in 6 out of 10 American families, but earn 84 percent of what men earn; applauds Pres Obama for recognizing Equal Pay Day and calls for more steps to address discrepancy; faults Republicans for blocking consideration of the Paycheck Fairness Act and holds that wage injustice matters to all Americans, regardless of party.
lead_paragraph: The problem persists even in workplaces committed to gender equality, and those who stand in the way of fairness do so at their own peril.

headline.main: The Truth About the Pay Gap
